title: Unblock guest template viewing and remove subscription/paywall gating in template flow (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Ensure Template Gallery and Template Detail always render template content for guests, with resilient fallback to seed templates when backend template fetch fails.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting /templates while logged out renders a non-empty grid of templates (at minimum the existing seed templates) with each card showing name, category, and description.
Visiting /templates/$templateId while logged out renders the template detail page content (title, category badge, description, and preview image area) without crashing.
If the backend call to fetch templates fails or is unauthorized, the UI still renders templates via the existing seed template fallback (no blank/empty page).

file_operations.description: Harden template fetching to always return a non-empty fallback (SEED_TEMPLATES) on any backend failure/unauthorized scenario, and ensure the query never resolves to an empty/undefined list for guest browsing.
Ensure logged-out users see a non-empty gallery by relying on the existing hook fallback; adjust empty/error rendering so the page never appears blank when backend templates are unavailable.

Make the template detail view robust for guest access by rendering a stable preview image area even when thumbnail data is missing/unexpected, and avoid any crashes when templates load via fallback seed data.

requirements.summary: Remove subscription/paywall gating from routing, CTAs, and UI copy so users can copy/customize templates without subscription checks.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove the router-level subscription guard so the editor route /editor/$templateId is not wrapped by RequireSubscription in frontend/src/App.tsx.

Template detail CTA no longer routes users to /pricing due to missing subscription; the primary CTA should only depend on authentication/registration requirements (e.g., prompt login if logged out, otherwise allow continuing to editor).
All user-facing copy on TemplateGalleryPage, TemplateDetailPage, and TemplateEditorPage is updated to remove subscription-required messaging (use English text).
Brand header subscription badge is removed or no longer depends on subscription state (no Premium/Pro badge based on subscription).

file_operations.description: Remove subscription gating from /editor/$templateId by unwrapping RequireSubscription; wire the editor route to only enforce authentication/registration requirements (e.g., RequireRegistered) without any subscription checks.

Remove subscription-based CTA logic: drop subscription query usage, stop routing to /pricing for template copying, and update CTA labels/copy so authenticated (and registered via route guard) users can proceed to the editor.

Remove all subscription enforcement in the editor UI: delete subscription checks/redirects/blocking states, update error/toast messaging to no longer mention subscriptions, and keep only login/registration-dependent behavior.
Update gallery page headline/description and any messaging to remove subscription-required/premium gating language while keeping template browsing behavior unchanged.
Remove the subscription badge (Premium/Pro) from the header and eliminate any header UI that depends on subscription state for displaying subscription tier.
